intro: Prevostea sphaerocephala, commonly known as the globe-headed bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive spherical flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture. The flowers are blue or violet in color, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat.
